website_summaries.verdict: A popular high-quality motor from a top brand that is reliable, quiet, and durable.
pros: This model features a 30-inch composite shaft and highly responsive steering
The tiller has a telescoping feature so you can adjust it to your comfort level
Additionally, the unit is equipped with a quick-release lever-locking bracket to facilitate backtrolling
cons: When using in reverse, a few models may feature an undesirable amount of vibration

customer_reviews.title: A Great motor
customer_reviews.text: Works Great! but do yourself a favor, make certain you put an inline fuse on the hot wire. It will save the motor. I used a 30amp. First time out, i got caught in a heavy weed bed. It blew the fuse before I burned up the motor.
customer_reviews.author: R. L. Pederson

customer_reviews.title: Kayak motor
customer_reviews.text: Just hooked it up to my kayak, can’t wait to get on the water!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Tuff little motor
customer_reviews.text: Stealth power for my Sundolphin 2. Moves it with ease even with a load of dive tanks. Ran it into the rocks and slight noise at top speed but still going strong after a month of serious abuse.
customer_reviews.author: Mavricky

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a kayak
customer_reviews.text: Great addition to my fishing kayak. It motors my kayak across the larger bodies of water when I need it. It and a Mighty Max Battery 12V 55Ah are a good combination.
customer_reviews.author: B. OwenTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Good, inexpensive trolling motor
customer_reviews.text: Good, inexpensive trolling motor. It's incredibly energy efficient. We ran it on high speed for 4 straight hours and still had 75% of the battery life.
customer_reviews.author: D. Knowles

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Can't even give one star. Hooked it up and used it for about 5 minutes and then it quit. Took it to an "authorized dealer" for warranty where it has sat for 4 weeks. Yup. Nothing like buying a brand new trolling motor that doesn't work. Thank you Minn Kota for selling me a piece of junk. Ha. Tried to submit with no stars; however, Amazon is going to force me to give this piece of junk 1 star. I guess Amazon feels my 5 minutes of use deserves at least 1 star!
customer_reviews.author: Malcolm

customer_reviews.title: Perfect addition to any craft!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my current inflatable boats. One is 12ft and the other is 14ft. Ended up replacing the prop with a 3 blade aftermarket prop. Runs amazing on canals and lakes. Even with strong spring currents here in Florida, it will get you moving against it decently. Paired this with a 100ah Renogy battery, and its the dream setup. Easily can do 4+ hours on constant full-throttle and still have plenty of life left for slower cruising. Ages ago, I had one of these on a 16ft jon boat and I'm glad to see the quality is still there!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Nice (update)
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t had chance to use the motor yet, but it’s simple and looks well made. I was under the impression it had a battery gauge but I was mistaken. So after using my new motor, this thing has plenty of power, but be aware of weeds !! Doesn’t cope well with them and to stop the motor getting clogged I recommend a 50amp in-line fuse /breaker which Tripped often while in the weeds which saved the motor from possibly burning out. Also one more thing, reverse is practically non existent, but this seems to be a common problem with trawling motors.
customer_reviews.author: Rottsrool

customer_reviews.title: Nice and powerful
customer_reviews.text: 55 pounds of thrust does as advertised. Simple installation and coulda with all the parts you need.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Russell

customer_reviews.title: great all around electric trolling motor.
customer_reviews.text: excellent trolling motor. very quiet and worked great right out of the box. easy set up.have a new die hard deep cell battery and charger. fished completely around my lake, a good sized lake mind you and at end of the day, battery life was 75 to 80 per cent.5 forward speeds. does not spook the fish.i would estimate the speed at 5 to be about 3.5 miles per hour but faster with wind. only downside, reverse speeds are not as responsive as forward. prop is designed for forward speed basically..great buy at the price. highly recommend.beats rowing.
customer_reviews.author: mg

customer_reviews.title: Quality of product is not what it once was
customer_reviews.text: It’s a Minn Kota, the quality of these motors has definitely suffered over the last 5 or so years, I had to remove the top cover and lubricate the retraction handle just to make it usable, bearing in mind this is straight out of the box. I love minn Kota, but quality is not what it once was.
customer_reviews.author: Jamies music

customer_reviews.title: Defective out of The Box.
customer_reviews.text: Minn Kota makes quality products but this trolling motor was defective right out of the box. The tighten down mechanism that you turn to lock the motor in place so it does not spin left or right. Was completely stripped out. It just spins and never tightens up so that the shaft will not move. I would have given 5 stars but being defective from the factory gives it a two star.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice motor for the money.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little pusher. Moves my 12 foot alum boat with 2 at about 3 mph. 5 forward and 3 reverse speeds. I did notice the wire getting quite warm. That tells me it is probably undersized. Measures 12 guage and should be 10 guage, IMHO. But that get's it 4 stars not 5.
customer_reviews.author: LMH

customer_reviews.title: But the two went like hand and glove
customer_reviews.text: Only used once so far in major wind. 5th speed has some power. Using interstate DCM 0075 75 amp hour AGM deep cycle battery. $250.00 battery. But the two went like hand and glove. I tried and index motor 40 thrust and failed. Tried to save some money and and ended up returning intex to buy Minn kota. Much more power. Requires 50 amp circuit breaker. sold separately.
customer_reviews.author: blackstone

customer_reviews.title: prop could be more efficient in reverse and wires are not long enough.
customer_reviews.text: It is a good product however I am a little disappointed that the handle does not pivot up and down like the old ones, and it is not very efficient in reverse and it takes a lot of battery to move the boat backwards so I have to turn the whole thing around 180 degrees to get my boat to move back. Also they could have given a longer wires. I have to prop my battery up on the back of the boat to reach the wires.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Dead on 3rd use
customer_reviews.text: Failed on 3rd use. Melting power head, electrical smell. Beyond amazon return window. Now need to find a MK service center.
customer_reviews.author: MN mama

customer_reviews.title: Not fast or powerful, but gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: Good enough for my purposes. I use it on a 14 foot aluminum utility boat. Not fast and gets tangled in weeds easily. I have to raise the gasoline outboard to decrease drag to get any speed. This was the size suggested by Minn Kota for my boat. It's good enough to do the job I need done.
customer_reviews.author: John B.

customer_reviews.title: Sweet!!!
customer_reviews.text: I just installed this motor this morning on my 14' Jon boat. It is whisper quiet. Speeds 1-2 are super slow, 3 is still slow but you are moving forward, 4 is a good cruise, 5 is double the speed of 4 and actually leaves a small wake behind the boat. It works great, I am looking forward to using it more this summer
customer_reviews.author: Chris F.

customer_reviews.title: Great Motor for 14 ft Jon Boat
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these from Wal-Mart in 2002. (40 lb thrust, 36" shaft) It was still running great in 2019 until I mounted it too close to my gas motor and damaged it. I Immediately got on Amazon and ordered another one like it. The new one works just like the old one, great. Pushes my 14 ft Alumacraft up to 3.0 mph. If I need to go faster I use my gas motor. I hope this one lasts me 17 years too. I wonder how long the first one would have ran if I would not have damaged it by accident? These can't be beat for pushing a lightweight 14 footer for trolling.
customer_reviews.author: R J Adams

customer_reviews.title: Reverse does not have enough power to back a rubber raft and vibrates in both directions.
customer_reviews.text: Besides not having enough trust in reverse to back up a rubber raft it vibrates a lot in both directions. I expected more with products from Minn Kota. The speed/direction controls do not indicate correctly. The unit is still in forward-1 when showing off. All values are off in both directions. The only upside is the thrust in the forward 5 speeds is good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good purchase
customer_reviews.text: I heated the blades so I could bend them inward. This method is for attracting certain types of fish. The blades are lowered just to the water surface and the blades make a splashing sound which fish take to other fish feeding on baitfish. A great way to bring fish to the boat and the bait. I wish the company made pre-formed blades for the trolling motors for this purpose. :)
customer_reviews.author: Gordon R Sallee

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend. Adjustable, good power, lightweight.
customer_reviews.text: Husband researched these for two weeks, probably read hundreds of reviews knowing him! When he settles on what he's going to buy, it's usually a good purchase. This was no exception. We bought this to use on our canoe and we are very happy. So quiet, love the different speeds, lightweight ( which is good because we don't leave it mounted to the canoe and have to put it in each time). We have it in the canoe and tightened down in under three minutes- it's that easy. Pretty powerful too- with weight of a larger canoe and two adults, we are going across the lake a good clip.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Woods

customer_reviews.title: Advertised as Used by Amazon
customer_reviews.text: This little motors are great. This one was advertised as used (box damage). I saved $7 because of that. I have bought used from Amazon several times, however this motor had monofilament wrapped around the shaft behind the prop. More than box damage.. I removed the monofilament and it works fine. It does vibrate pretty bad on the higher speed (4,5) but it is less than $100. It has good power for a 30lb thrust. Solid 4 star for the price..
customer_reviews.author: willrussellville

customer_reviews.title: Great trolling motor in forward, reverse is pathetic.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my boat. Finally got on the water yesterday and it pushes my 79 sears fiberglass tri hull easily everywhere. I won’t need my bow mount now. The only thing I don’t like is the prop, it’s awesome in all forward gears but reverse really is pathetic. If you need a better prop for reverse get the MKP-6 prop. I’m going to get it and try it. Hopefully it’ll be better in reverse and comparable to the original in forward.
customer_reviews.author: Mindy Kersey

customer_reviews.title: This is my first time using a trolling motor so ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time using a trolling motor so feel free to disregard this review, but it seemed quite frustrating to maneuver the boat with this guy, and the only time we seemed to really get anywhere was on the fastest speed (yes, there was a little bit of wind). Overall, expected things to work more smoothly. Maybe that was my mistake
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my one person inflatable pontoon, works great, also bought the rudder and I get around out on the water just fine. I can troll with the big boys and get into places the boats can't get to. Love it!! Also, if you've ever had to row yourself across a bay in the wind, this will save your arms.
customer_reviews.author: RiverRunRusticWoodCrafts

customer_reviews.title: Pushes a mini-pontoon great
customer_reviews.text: We were gifted a mini-pontoon that needed some work and a new transom mount trolling motor. This has worked perfectly. Our boat is a 14x6 ft Sweet Water mini-toon and we regularly have 4 people out and about with this motor pushing us through the water just fine. When fully cranked up, we get it up to 4 MPH. Have even pulled the youngster behind it on a SUP to simulate skiing. Was super funny and fun but it didn't have any issues pulling him. (Grown 17 y/o) I did get a pretty heavy duty battery and we can easily go several weeks without charging. This was a great purchase for our particular needs.
customer_reviews.author: Rock

customer_reviews.title: Good basic motor.
customer_reviews.text: Nice motor for the money, but I have since sold it in favor of a variable speed unit. The 5 speeds just don't have enough versatility for fishing, and it drains the battery faster than the variable speed motors. If you have weeds, by all means get a weedless prop for it.
customer_reviews.author: CloverLeaf

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: I mounted the motor to my Intex Mariner 3 inflatable boat and it works amazing. I had huge doubts about the 30lbs trolling motors power but that little engine pushed about 400lbs with no problems through extremely choppy water.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Nunes

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: We use this attached to a 2 person canoe and it works great. The motor is well built and has plenty of HP for calm body of water / lake if no gas motors are allowed. It has no problem against a <10 MPH breeze. Dont expect to go faster then 2-3 mph but what would you expect from an electric trolling motor?
customer_reviews.author: beachnut443

customer_reviews.title: For the price, you cannot beat this trolling motor ...
customer_reviews.text: For the price, you cannot beat this trolling motor. I used it for my kayak, shortened the shaft a few inches and powering it with a cheap marine battery. I have been out for about 12 hours of fishing with intermittent use of the trolling motor and it has not bothered the battery even a little. It is also very quiet in operation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You get what you paid for
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this maybe almost a month ago and able to get on the water twice. It works well and easy operate. And only used it for twice and really not sure how long it will last. The noise lever is quiet on speed 1 to 3 but not sure why the 4 to 5 are loud. Also for the going speed it's pretty good and steady and just when coming back trip my speed going lower and not sure because of my battery or just the motor itself. Anyway for the price is affordable so yea will give it a try.
customer_reviews.author: Beny Fam

customer_reviews.title: No stars...reverse didn't work
customer_reviews.text: Used for the first time on April, and reverse was noisy and didn't work.
customer_reviews.author: JWG

customer_reviews.title: Quite motor
customer_reviews.text: Wish it had a tilt handle. Wish the prop hub fit would eliminate line getting behind the prop so you have to remove the prop to clear the line.
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie Weatherman

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Moves my Intex Excursion 5 like a dream, super quiet and smooth. It’s scary how quiet it is, I often had to check if it was still on! It goes pretty fast, even with a fully loaded boat, I love this motor!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly for what we wanted. Mounted it to ...
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly for what we wanted. Mounted it to a kayak with a bracket and now we're all over the lake with no rowing.
customer_reviews.author: ppearce

customer_reviews.title: Minn Kota C2 Trolling Motor
customer_reviews.text: Having used Minn Kota C2 30lb trolling motors for over 10 years my expectations for this C2 40lb trolling motor were very high. I was not disappointed. Was out for over 3 hours twice and still had 80% and 85% battery life respectively. Plenty of power to plow through heavy marine algae with my 12ft V bottom boat. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Miker

customer_reviews.title: Really good motor for the price
customer_reviews.text: I went back and forth to get the biggest bang for the buck. I have now used it a few times and am very happy I decided on this. For its maiden voyage I used it to power a 14' aluminum boat with 4 of us in it. At it's highest speed (5) it actually put out a wake! It was cold and rainy with moderate wind but it handled it well. I was worried about the battery draw but I had it at full throttle for at least 90 minutes and my battery had plenty of juice to spare. Very good motor.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Nice little motor
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to add to my kayak for long distances. It doesn't really make me go faster than if I paddled full speed, but saves me from getting tired when I use the kayak for going a long ways in to hunt. Not a bad motor. Weeds do tend to clog it up so I'd probably not recommend this if you're using it in a weedy lake/river.
customer_reviews.author: Annette Protz

customer_reviews.title: Mixed review
customer_reviews.text: Motor seems fine. Very disappointed the rebate form wasn't included with the order. Only today found the requirement was to download and print form and purchase confirmation. Not convenient for me and now I discover rebate request requires a postmark of June 30. Tell me the manufacturer couldn't handle this on line via purchase info, or at least when purchase is registered online. I resent being made to jump through hoops to realize the offered price.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: It's a bottom feeder.
customer_reviews.text: So I have used another trolling motor for a couple years and it was only $20 more. It was so much better than this one. It had a battery light to tell me exactly where the level on the battery was. The Minn Kota has nothing. The reverse on the Minn Kota is horrible. I have a small gheenoe flats boat and it doesn't weight much at all. The Saltwater Vessel's brand was a much better trolling motor for only a couple more dollars.
customer_reviews.author: deester

customer_reviews.title: Handles my 16' Lund fine but shifts with too much thrust between settings
customer_reviews.text: Handles my 16' Lund fine but shifts with too much thrust between settings. Battery seems to last longer than the old model Minn Kota's !!
customer_reviews.author: Pete Kraft

customer_reviews.title: The perfect size motor
customer_reviews.text: Used it this morning bass fishing, my 4th Minn Kota trolling motor. Longer shaft allows me to set it higher so that I don’t have to bend over from my pedestal seat to operate it. The 35 pound thrust to this motor gives me much more power in reverse than the 30. The 55 was too heavy for me to handle. This motor is perfect with the mini, 22 pound battery that lasts me for the 4 hours that I want to bass fish.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmie D

customer_reviews.title: Almost lasted the 2 year warranty.
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine until the motor broke just before the warranty ran out. Then what do you do? Major hassle, would rather have the motor working than deal with a warranty issue. So I just purchased a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan County

customer_reviews.title: Not a ton of power but it's better than rowing on small lakes
customer_reviews.text: I have a 15 foot fiberglass v bottom boat and the biggest deep cycle battery I could find. I've ran this troller for 6+ hours on speeds 1-3, and occasionally on 5, and never ran out of juice. There is no battery meter on the troller, I use the one on my locator that also uses the same battery. Keep this in mind if this troller will be used to cover some water and you have no plan b for propulsion.
customer_reviews.author: Fixit Jake

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in this purchase
customer_reviews.text: We are having to buy another motor already. Purchased 2017 in June, used for 3 months, every other weekend and just tried it this year for it to keep slipping into the water . Disappointed in this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Loud noise and vibrations!
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. Unboxed and took it to the lake and it made very loud strange noises. Continuous vibrations. Requested for a replacement. Hopefully the new one runs quiet and smooth but have to take time to drop off this defective one at a UPS store.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: too many problems with this motor...right from the beginning
customer_reviews.text: This company has an excellent history of quality products. This is surprising that I am having so many problems. The one I purchased from Amazon has had problems with performance and has stopped running twice. I have had it repaired by a qualified Authorized service company but I am still having problems. I don't know if this was a re-manufactured motor and sold as new on Amazon. I hope I will get a response for Amazon or Minn Kota. Very unhappy...I do not recommend buying this electric motor. I will follow up with more information after a get a response. I will forward an honest review.
customer_reviews.author: Robert michael

customer_reviews.title: Amazon issue
customer_reviews.text: Got hosed by Amazon, product advertised as new but handle has a defect and won't stay in head unit, guess that's it was cheaper. Missed my return window bya few days, it's still winter so just got around to unboxing and finding defective issue.
customer_reviews.author: MickeyB

customer_reviews.title: Great motor for the price
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is a great motor. Plenty of power for my 14' aluminum boat, good adjustments on forward and reverse.
customer_reviews.author: Professional Consumer #1

customer_reviews.title: Maybe I just got a bad one
customer_reviews.text: This product is super noisy , sounds like a cat motor with a bad crankshaft , had a really bad vibration in it also . I’ve had several other trolling motors , this one is bad , Thos would scare fish away for 10 miles
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Little Motor that Could!
customer_reviews.text: This is the little motor that could! I use my canoe 500% more since acquiring my Minn Kota. Combined with a 35ah battery, I can troll for several days. I now take morning and evening pleasure cruises without getting wet or changing clothes. When the fish are jumping, I am on the water! I have been torturing this little motor for the better part of a year.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Good little engine
customer_reviews.text: We use this on a raft. Engine is a strong performer, easy to use and the options allow you to angle it in a few different positions and bring it up easily. The blades do get tangled up a lot in weeds, but this is not a detraction of the motor, just the fact that our lake has a lot of 'Freddy Kruger' grass. But pulling the weeds off is a snap. Engine is a winner.
customer_reviews.author: Albert C

customer_reviews.title: good power
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for use with my Klamath 15' aluminum fishing boat. It has good power when trolling. I seem to have less battery drain than previous trolling motors.
customer_reviews.author: M V R

customer_reviews.title: Problems with vibration
customer_reviews.text: The item had good power and was as expected for mounting and ease of use. I have to ship it back though, because of the excessive vibration under load at high reverse and high forward. My last Minn Kota was quiet and stable through the entire range and I was only replacing it because the permanent magnet cracked after about 15 years. I had high expectations I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Parker

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Very fast on my kayak, easy to mount, and very fun!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Gully

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy these!
customer_reviews.text: Absolute junk! Clearly a problem with quality! I ordered the first one and it came crushed. Returned it and the replacement didn’t work at all. Returned that one and the replacement worked for only 6 weeks and is dead. Of course now outside of the return time since they are basing the time of purchase on the first order (the crushed one). This is ridiculous! I suggest buying from a store such as Dick’s sporting good or Farm and Fleet!
customer_reviews.author: Cliff

customer_reviews.title: Suiting my needs just fine but puzzled by the huge jump between the two ...
customer_reviews.text: Suiting my needs just fine but puzzled by the huge jump between the two top speeds. It's like a rocket taking off when u select high speed
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked well until it didn't. Contacting customer service via company website is not recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Died on me after just over 1 year of very limited service into a two year warranty. Contacted customer service almost a week ago via their website and have yet to hear from them. Fishing season is waning and no trolling motor.
customer_reviews.author: monte

customer_reviews.title: Unbeatable price
customer_reviews.text: Good motor, incredible price. This gets my sevylor inflatable boat with two people and a 30 lb battery going what seems like 3 knots. Not the fastest, but will get the job done. I recommend one of the 50+ lb thrust motors if you have enough money and want to go a little faster.
customer_reviews.author: Joe (Seattle)

customer_reviews.title: Minn Kota
customer_reviews.text: I have always used Minn Kota products because all products are well made and a good buy. This motor runs great and pushes my 14 foot aluminum well.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Good Motor for the money
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 16ft john boat. We use it on lakes and ponds in the area that don't allow gas motors. Does a good job and moved the boat right along with two larger people in it. Would purchase again and would recommend to anyone looking for an inexpensive option to do the same.
customer_reviews.author: Force1PD

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase.
customer_reviews.text: You will not find a better trolling motor. Well priced, excellent quality and easy to install. If you are looking for another trolling motor or have never had one before this is the one to get.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Hinesley

customer_reviews.title: 5 forward speeds ONLY 3 reverse
customer_reviews.text: Good powerful forward motor with 5 speeds. BUT reverse is non-existent, it has 3 speeds and on level 3 it barely even moves, took about 5 mins to back into a boat stall. I used an oar and it was faster! Don't expect the world out of this little motor
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Reliable easy to set up and It’s quite powerful
customer_reviews.text: Love this motor use it on my Seahawk 3 and 2 and 4 quiet basically silence works well with my 35 ah battery and 65 ah battery I use it on the Back Creek in Solomon MD in brackish water Never had any problems with the propeller or anything in the Seahawk 2 with two ppl and against the current with a few just over a foot swells and pushes us right through all and all great motor
customer_reviews.author: Robbie Snider

customer_reviews.title: Take a Close Look at the Handle Before Leaving the Dock
customer_reviews.text: Handle broke within the first half hour of being on the water, making getting back to shore very difficult and somewhat scary. Have emailed seller but no response.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Good Motor for my application!
customer_reviews.text: Great trolling motor for pushing my 15’ aluminum V-hull about my 5 Ac pond! My Grandsons and I troll for Crappie all day for three days before returning deep cycle battery to charger! Plenty of pep and power to beat the wind and get around. The reverse speeds (3) are weaker than any of the forward speeds (5) but would get us out of any jam!
customer_reviews.author: DB Murray

customer_reviews.title: Efficient,  lightweight and durable
customer_reviews.text: well I never owned one of these, bought it for my dinghy. very light weight and quiet. Like the the speed settings. easy to hook up and take off.. light weight and ease of use. I don't fish but man you can sneak up on them I suspect... Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: L. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: This has a lot of power, pushed 12 foot aluminum boat with 3 adults with enough force to generate a wake off and on for several hours before requiring a charge.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Konrad

customer_reviews.title: Mixed review
customer_reviews.text: I have a Sun dolphin 2 man boat... The 30 does not do good against the wind or upstream. I prayed that I could make it back to shore. Boat runs great going with the flow of the stream. I’m going to try the 55.
customer_reviews.author: Allenpowered

customer_reviews.title: We easily get two to three trips out of a charge ...
customer_reviews.text: Literally a life safer. We use it on a small sailboat when we come into channels, bridges, ports etc when we used to have to rely on playing the wind perfectly or plenty of paddling. I'm running it off a MightyMax35 battery that's small and lightweight. We easily get two to three trips out of a charge that amount to about an hour of full speed (5) and 20 minutes on 2-4.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: This is the best trolling motor that only requires 1 12volt battery
customer_reviews.text: This is the best trolling motor that only requires 1 12volt battery. No issues with speeding around the lake with this bad boy. These sellers had the best price around and everything about my purchase was perfect!
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Very good trolling motor for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Good trolling motor for the price. Have this trolling motor hooked up to my 20 ft patio boat , works great.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Saito

customer_reviews.title: It's Minn Kota...so you know it's a keeper.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice powerful basic trolling motor. Will pull my 20 pontoon at decent speed. Will make my 15 ft. Flat bottom fly!
customer_reviews.author: Horse

customer_reviews.title: Minn Kota  c2 30
customer_reviews.text: Worked better then I thought, GREAT. and reberse slower and faster couple setting, my husband loved it, great for our 14 ft boat on the lake.
customer_reviews.author: shallbe

customer_reviews.title: Pushed a 10' jon boat with sometime 1000 lbs no problem. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Paired with a SLI31MDC battery from Batteries +. These 2 fell in love at first sight. Only ran motor once before making review but very solid made and works well! Ran for about 5 total hours pushing a loaded 10' x 4' aluminum jon boat with jug & trot line weights, 2 man crew almost weighing 500 lbs combined, 2 batteries totaling little over 100 lbs, gear and hauled in some 3 ft catfish. Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: OneBadTexan

customer_reviews.title: Fast delivery and product is as expected. I ran ...
customer_reviews.text: Fast delivery and product is as expected. I ran it around on a lake with a 13ft inflatable dive boat for 4 hours at level 4 or 5 and had 2/3 battery life left.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon C.

customer_reviews.title: Wow - super quiet
customer_reviews.text: We finally got to use it this weekend - its been waiting for months. Super impressed with it - its quiet and we trolled that lake for more than 4 hours without a hitch. My only wish is that it had a battery level meter on it.
customer_reviews.author: P. Buchanan

customer_reviews.title: jus bought
customer_reviews.text: jus bought trolling motor.. tested in garbage can with water..ran great... ran it 2hours straight..then let it rest 1 hour then ran it straight for 4 hours..ran great!!! will do another review after I get my inflatable excursion 5 on the water...QUESTION..How do I get a bill of sale..i lost receipt I copied from computer.
customer_reviews.author: runningman

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is a super sweet little trolling motor. I have the intex exxursion 5 with a wood floor, cooler, 1 friend, and a dog and this think really cranks you. I am very happy with the product and it looks awesome too.
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Performance
customer_reviews.text: I had a bow mounted trolling motor; however, I do most of my fishing from the back of the boat. I have a 16.5 foot deep V and this trolling motor provides great thrust.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Good! but i would have gone a size bigger for my application.
customer_reviews.text: underpowered for my 14ft bass boat but thats my fault for not doing my research. great for maintaining position and moving around in fishing holes as a companion to an outboard. I suppose it would be great on a 12ft jon boat or canoe/kayak. very durable. takes abuse well. very long battery life on a #27 deep cycle
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This motor pulls my 15' open bow very well. I bout it in case my outboard conked out, but found it is perfect for riding through alcoves where people are fishing and swimming. This model has a longer shaft and more power. Has not drained my battery once.
customer_reviews.author: Ronn

customer_reviews.title: Great value!!
customer_reviews.text: We have had this for a while and it has not disappointed us yet. It isn't noisy. Easy to set up. Very easy to use. Actually the first day we used it, our main motor to our boat died.. ugh. But, this little motor was our life saver. Slow and steady, it got us to land. We were so thankful. It is more than worth it's money. Great value!
customer_reviews.author: SLK

customer_reviews.title: Prop broken.
customer_reviews.text: Prop broken right out of the box. It’s so frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Luz

customer_reviews.title: Double check before purchasing.
customer_reviews.text: When i purchased didn't realize it was for fresh water, but still used it in salt water just rinsed it with water and can't tell any difference. Hopefully nothing happens to it in the long run just gonna have to wait and see. Other than that work great for my sundolfin 102 fishing boat.
customer_reviews.author: Rene A.

customer_reviews.title: Impressive power.
customer_reviews.text: Really impressed with the power. It had no problem pushing my 12.5 foot inflatable around a good sized mountain lake here in Utah. Going back to the ramp was a chore against a 9 mph head wind. But this motor did the job nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: disappointed by the performance with the price I bought
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed by its performance with the price I bought C2 30 for $229.95!!! I think this was way overpriced! But don't know why I could not find a better deal back in July. Re-searching now I'm seeing many many better deals. With this price I could have bought a much stronger motor. Or for a 30 lb thrust with a much cheaper price! Please don't make mistake like I did.
customer_reviews.author: PHAN

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very good trolling motor. My wife and I really like it because it's so quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's worth it at the price
customer_reviews.text: Battery level has nothing to do with this product considering it doesn't come with a batter. It's built well and barley makes noise compared to other like gas trolling motors. If you mount this on a dingy you will need to register it
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: great value, priced cheaper then most used motors
customer_reviews.text: Best value on the market. I only really need it for positioning once a year in the Eagler River Musky nationals. Saves me a lot of time jerking around to hold the boat for my casts.
customer_reviews.author: Dad who reviews

customer_reviews.title: Ordered 2 of these at different times both arrived damaged and unusable buy locally
customer_reviews.text: The product was an excellent product however mine came damaged so badly I couldn’t use it so it was returned. Purchased one locally since this happened 2 times with amazon (both delivered broken)
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Blackwelder

customer_reviews.title: Small lake motor
customer_reviews.text: Man this thing is fast makes my canoe stand straight up. Suggest only for mature adults.
customer_reviews.author: Red Team 98

customer_reviews.title: Great deal!
customer_reviews.text: Put on the back of a pedal boat for peaceful twilight cruises. Got on a "warehouse deal" for a steal. Works good and has a pretty good run time on mid speed.
customer_reviews.author: KMK

customer_reviews.title: Beginning boater
customer_reviews.text: With this, an Intex Seahawk or something similar, and a deep cycle marine battery, you can have a boat for around 200 dollars. I have used this in a ton of lakes, rivers, and even the ocean.
customer_reviews.author: Wild Gravity

customer_reviews.title: Great motor great price.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for a fishing kayak.... works great! It even kicks up a wake from my kayak on the highest speed. Would definitely recommend it. Great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Les Mas

customer_reviews.title: Great little motor
customer_reviews.text: Second one of these I’ve had for my squareback canoe. These are great. I troll for walleye on speed 2, and it really scoots on 5. For under $100, can’t beat it
customer_reviews.author: Andy Beare

customer_reviews.title: Great little motor!
customer_reviews.text: Motor works great! We have the Seahawk 3, this motor, motor mount and battery. Lasted all day with no issues and got us to/from in a timely manner. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Invictus

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our canoe
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for our canoe. Handy because a lot of ponds won't allow gas engines. Anxious for the nice weather so we can use it again. Be sure to use a marine battery that's fully charged. On 1 ride we ran into heavy wind & our battery died. Of course we had paddles with us, just in case
customer_reviews.author: JANICE SEARS

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Great at running my Intex Excursion 5 inflatable boat around.
customer_reviews.author: pinky

product_meta.title: Minn Kota Endura Transom Mount Trolling Motor
feature_bullets: Lever Lock Bracket: This solid 10-position bracket features a quick-release lever lock and reinforced composite material that resists flexing, warping, and UV damage
Telescoping Tiller: Get easy, comfortable, intuitive operation of your trolling motor with the six-inch telescoping tiller.
5 Fwd/3 Rev Speed Settings: Five speed settings for forward and three speed settings for reverse.
Power Prop: For 3-1/4" motor diameters, this prop delivers extra power to push throw heavy vegetation. Includes prop pin, nut and washer.
Indestructible Composite Shaft — for Life: At the core of your Minn Kota trolling motor is an indestructable composite shaft. It's a Minn Kota exclusive, and we it for life.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
